Title: Long-Term Memory for Large Language Models Through Topic-Based Vector Database
Abstract: large language models  large language model  have garnered sub stantial attention and significantly transformed the landscape of artificial intelligence due to their human like understanding and generation capabilities. however despite their excellent capabilities large language model lack the latest information and are constrained by limited context memory which limits their effectiveness in many real time applications that require up to date information such as personal artificial intelliegence assistants. inspired by the recent study on enhancing large language model with infinite external memory using vector database this paper proposes a topic based vector database to enable large language model to achieve long term personalized memory. by leveraging prompt engineering to fully utilize the semantic understanding capabilities of large language model an efficient topic based per sonalized memory management system is designed to store and update user preferences and characteristics. this system can be applied in various artificial intelliegence assistant domains such as companion robots to efficiently store personal memories of users through conversations ultimately fulfilling their needs in a personalized manner.
